icontrol.drivers

Interface TMCTL_Driver.TMCTL

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.sun.jna.Library
    Enclosing class:
    TMCTL_Driver

    private static interface TMCTL_Driver.TMCTL
extends com.sun.jna.Library
    Defines the interface required by JNA to invoke the native library.

    This interface defines all function calls 'into' the native code (.dll). It is the standard, stable way of mapping, which supports extensive customization and mapping of Java to native types.

    Please note that all function declaration have been imported from tmctl.h, but only the uncommented method declarations have been tested. To use a native function that is currently commented, uncomment it, ensure the data type conversion is correct, and test it. The tmctl.h file defines also functions that start with x... but seem otherwise to be identical. Could not find what the difference is, so the 'regular' functions are used.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.sun.jna.Library

      • TmcDeviceClear

        int TmcDeviceClear(int DeviceID)
        Executes a selected device clear (SDC). This is a GPIB-specific command. The tmctl read me(ENG).txt is not so clear, but it appears harmless if called for non-GPIB ports.

        Receives a message (after preparation) from a device.

      • TmcReceiveBlockHeader

        int TmcReceiveBlockHeader(int DeviceID,
                          com.sun.jna.ptr.IntByReference NrDataBytes)
        Receives the header portion of the Block Data sent from the device, and returns the number of bytes after the header. This is the first command to be used before receiving Block Data. The number of bytes in the data after the header is returned as the length, so that number plus 1 (for the terminator) is assigned to "TmcReceiveBlockData" and then the data is received.

      • TmcReceiveBlockData

        int TmcReceiveBlockData(int DeviceID,
                        java.nio.ByteBuffer Buffer,
                        int BufferLength,
                        com.sun.jna.ptr.IntByReference NrDataBytes,
                        com.sun.jna.ptr.IntByReference EndFlag)
        Receives the data portion of the Block Data sent from a device. Returns whether all of the number of bytes of data returned by "TmcReceiveBlockHeader" are finished being received. The value is 1 at the end of reception, or 0 if reception is to continue.

      • TmcCheckEnd

        int TmcCheckEnd(int DeviceID)
        Returns whether the message from the device is finished. Can be used with the GPIB, USB, Ethernet, USBTMC, and VXI-11 interfaces.

      • TmcGetLastError

        int TmcGetLastError(int DeviceID)
        Returns the number of the last error that occurred.

      • TmcSetTimeout

                  int TimeOut)
        Sets the timeout time for communications (100-6553600 ms)

      • TmcFinish

        int TmcFinish(int DeviceID)
        Closes the connection to a device.
